answers.answer: There are a variety of non-specific symptoms that has been comprehensively evaluated.  It is unlikely that I can come up with something over the internet that hasn't been thought of by your physicians already.Regarding the GI symptoms, I agree with the endoscopies and other tests.  Malabsorption can lead to loose bowels.  Sending the stool off for fat analysis can be done.  Obtaining blood tests and imaging to look at the pancreas can also be done.I can't think of further neurological tests that haven't already been done.  Blood tests looking for thyroid, B12 disorders, or diabetes should be considered.HIV is less likely given the negative testing.  If there still is concern, the test can be repeated.Regarding the chlamydia - I would have the prostate evaluated with a prostatic massage.  Infections here can be difficult to treat and may require extended courses of antibiotics.These options can be discussed with your personal physician.Followup with your personal physician is essential.This answer is not intended as and does not substitute for medical advice - the information presented is for patient education only. Please see your personal physician for further evaluation of your individual case.Kevin, M.D.kevinmd_

Thanks docStools have been sent for fat analysis and imaging has been done on pancreas with blood tests, no problems.Tests on Thyroid, B12 and diabetes have been done numerously and also no problems.Doc says no to more HIV and std tests as I have had 4 already sice symptoms started, all tests are negative.He also says that if it were hiv and all these symptoms are present, then tests would show positive?The last test was mid july.I also get car sick often when I never used to and am exhausted after a work-out?I know its alot to absorb but I dont know where to turn to anymore

Very Important!!!!!!!Look at your palms very closely under bright light or direct sunlight for at least about one minute.  Do you see what appears to be virus particles (very small glitter like appearance)?  If nothing is observed look again when your symptoms are at their worst.  If particles are observed, get a viral swab test done.
No offense intended, but viruses are only nanometers long. 1 nm = 1 billionth of a meter. You can't see them and if they refract light you couldn't see them shine either.

question: I hope this will be answered, Ive posted this before and paid but have had no responce!Im prity much desperate as I have had these problems now for over a year.Let me first give you my symptoms - On and off Diahhrea, Flatulence, Joint and Muscle pain, Fatigue, Mouth Ulcers, Nausea, Hand Tremors, Head-Aches, Ears feel "full" and are painfull, pins & needles in feet and hands, always exhausted.These have been coming on gradually and have got worse.It all started really when I had unprotected sex and got Chlamydia.I have been to the following doctors who have done numerous tests with no results -Physician - Numerous blood tests including full std and hiv tests.I have also done this 3 times after my first intial tests.As I am single, I have had numerous sexual exposures but have protected sex.My last tests were 4.5 months from a protected exposure and were all negative(Full std and hiv 4th generation) As I live in SA, this was my main concern and because all my problems started when I had numerous exposures.I have had unprotected oral on me, the tests were done a year after this so my Physician says it cannot be HIV?Also checked for Vitamin B12, Rhematoid Arthritis etcNeurologist - Had nerve tests done and a lumber punch to look for anything,He also did a head mri and chest x-ray and a abdominal ultrasound, no problems.(Not to sure what all is looked for in lumber puch?)Gastroentorologists x 2 - Had numerous tests done.Camera in both ways and also a capsule endoscopy with no problems.The second one thinks its Celiacs disease which the first one says no due to the lab results.I have been on a Gluten Free diet for 5 months with no results.I am currently on Azopress 100mg per dayRhemotologist - Cant find any problemsCardiologist - For chest pains,Had Angiogram done and no problems.Says I have valve protrusion but wont cause all these symptoms?I still worry that it is HIV because its not going away but the doc says no, tests will prove this?All my problems started from this, is a 4.5 month tets conclusive after my last possible protected exposure?
title: What is this?
